Head.title: Tension in the head area 🤯
Head.text: Gentle mobilization of the neck/back of the head 🤲 + breathing 🌬️ to reduce tension.

Neck.title: Neck / shoulder girdle 🧑‍🦱💆
Neck.text: Release of the trapezius and chest area 💪, activation of the interscapular region 🦴.

Chest.title: Chest / thoracic region 🫁
Chest.text: Mobilization of the thoracic spine 🌀 + breathing into the side ribs ↔️.

Subclavian area — right.title: Subclavian area (right) 👉
Subclavian area — right.text: Gentle release of the pectoralis minor 🤲, clavicular-scapular line 🦴 + posture 🧍.

Subclavian area — left.title: Subclavian area (left) 👈
Subclavian area — left.text: Gentle release of the pectoralis minor 🤲, clavicular-scapular line 🦴 + posture 🧍.

Upper back.title: Upper back / scapular zone 🦴
Upper back.text: Opening of the thoracic region 🌀 + activation of the rhomboids 🔺 and lower trapezius 💪.

Scapula — right.title: Right scapula 👉
Scapula — right.text: Scapular stabilization 🦴: control of scapula down/inward ⬇️➡️ (face pull).

Scapula — left.title: Left scapula 👈
Scapula — left.text: Scapular stabilization 🦴: control of scapula down/inward ⬇️⬅️ (face pull).

Lower back.title: Lower back 🧍‍♂️
Lower back.text: Unloading the lower back 🪑 + pelvis/glute activation 🍑.

Sacrum.title: Sacrum 🦴
Sacrum.text: Gentle mobilization of the sacrum 🤲 + engagement of pelvic stabilizers ⚖️.

Abdomen.title: Center / core 💪
Abdomen.text: Gentle core activation 🌟 and diaphragmatic breathing 🌬️.

Subcostal area — right.title: Subcostal area (right) 👉
Subcostal area — right.text: Breathing 🌬️ into the right subcostal area + diaphragm release 🫁.

Subcostal area — left.title: Subcostal area (left) 👈
Subcostal area — left.text: Breathing 🌬️ into the left subcostal area + diaphragm release 🫁.

Pelvis.title: Pelvis stabilization ⚖️
Pelvis.text: Centering of the pelvis 🦵 + stretching of the hip flexors 🤸.

Glute — right.title: Right glute 🍑👉
Glute — right.text: Glute activation 🍑 + knee control 🦵 over the foot 🦶.

Glute — left.title: Left glute 🍑👈
Glute — left.text: Glute activation 🍑 + knee control 🦵 over the foot 🦶.

Shoulder — right.title: Shoulder 💪👉
Shoulder — right.text: Mobilization of the shoulder girdle 🤸 + strengthening of scapular stabilizers 🦴.

Shoulder — left.title: Shoulder 💪👈
Shoulder — left.text: Mobilization of the shoulder girdle 🤸 + strengthening of scapular stabilizers 🦴.

Arm — right.title: Shoulder/elbow/wrist 💪👉
Arm — right.text: Mobilization of the shoulder girdle 🤸 + strengthening of scapular stabilizers 🦴.

Arm — left.title: Shoulder/elbow/wrist 💪👈
Arm — left.text: Mobilization of the shoulder girdle 🤸 + strengthening of scapular stabilizers 🦴.

Elbow — right.title: Elbow 💪👉
Elbow — right.text: Mobilization of the shoulder girdle 🤸 + strengthening of scapular stabilizers 🦴.

Elbow — left.title: Elbow 💪👈
Elbow — left.text: Mobilization of the shoulder girdle 🤸 + strengthening of scapular stabilizers 🦴.

Wrist — right.title: Hand / wrist — right ✋👉
Wrist — right.text: Mobilization of the shoulder girdle 🤸 + strengthening of scapular stabilizers 🦴.

Wrist — left.title: Hand / wrist — left ✋👈
Wrist — left.text: Mobilization of the shoulder girdle 🤸 + strengthening of scapular stabilizers 🦴.

Fingers — right.title: Fingers (right) 👆👉
Fingers — right.text: Finger mobilization ✌️ + fine motor skills, soft grip 🤏.

Fingers — left.title: Fingers (left) 👆👈
Fingers — left.text: Finger mobilization ✌️ + fine motor skills, soft grip 🤏.

Shin/calf — right.title: Right shin/calf 🦵👉
Shin/calf — right.text: Gentle shin mobilization 🤲 + work of the calf muscles 💪.

Shin/calf — left.title: Left shin/calf 🦵👈
Shin/calf — left.text: Gentle shin mobilization 🤲 + work of the calf muscles 💪.

Toes — right.title: Toes (right) 👣👉
Toes — right.text: Toe mobilization 🤲 + work with the arch 👣.

Toes — left.title: Toes (left) 👣👈
Toes — left.text: Toe mobilization 🤲 + work with the arch 👣.

Bilateral pain.title: Bilateral pain ↔️
Bilateral pain.text: Basic mobilization 🤸 + breathing 🌬️ + light core activation 💪.

Several zones.title: Several zones 🗺️
Several zones.text: Start with basic spine mobilization 🌀 + breathing 🌬️, then — by symptoms 🔍.

I want to take a mini-diagnosis.title: Mini-diagnosis 🔍
I want to take a mini-diagnosis.text: Posture 🧍, breathing 🌬️, basic movements 🤸 — then personalization 🎯.

What is the nature of the pain?.Sharp: Sharp pain means the body needs rest 😥. Try to reduce the load and take care of yourself 🤲.

What is the nature of the pain?.Dull: Dull pain often appears due to muscle overstrain 😖. Light exercise and rest will help reduce it 🧘‍♀️.

What is the nature of the pain?.Pulling: Pulling pain may signal muscle imbalance 🎯. Gentle stretching and strengthening exercises will be helpful 💪.

What is the nature of the pain?.Burning: Burning pain is sometimes related to nerves 🔥. Move carefully and listen to your body 👂.

How long does the pain last?.Constant: Constant pain requires attention ⚠️. Try to reduce load and consult a specialist if needed 🩺.

How long does the pain last?.Periodic: Periodic pain is often related to load or stress 📊. Watch the situations when it appears 🔍.

When did the pain appear?.For the first time: If the pain appeared for the first time, pay attention to the causes and avoid overloading the body 🆕.

When did the pain appear?.A long time ago: Long-lasting pain requires a careful approach and gradual restoration of balance 📅.

When did the pain appear?.Suddenly: Sudden pain may be related to a sharp movement or injury ⚡. Be careful 🚨.

Were there injuries or surgeries?.Yes: Previous injuries and surgeries leave a mark on the body 🩹. Take this into account during loads ⚖️.

Were there injuries or surgeries?.No: There were no injuries or surgeries, so there are no special restrictions ✅.

Is there pain or radiation to another pa.Yes: Pain that radiates to other parts of the body may be related to nerves or muscles 🔗. Move carefully 🐢.

Is there pain or radiation to another pa.No: There is no radiating pain, you can safely continue usual movements 🆗.

Does the pain increase with movement? If.Does not increase: Pain does not increase with movement, which is very good 👍.

Does the pain increase with movement? If.While walking: Pain while walking may indicate load on the feet, pelvis or lower back 🚶‍♂️. Move carefully and take breaks ⏸️.

Does the pain increase with movement? If.During bends/turns: Pain during bending is often associated with the lower back or thoracic region 🔄. Strengthening exercises will help 💪.

Does the pain increase with movement? If.With any activity: Pain increases with any activity, so it is worth reducing the load and listening to the body 🔇.

What provokes the pain?.Load: Pain from load indicates muscle weakness or overload 🏋️‍♂️. Light recovery exercises will be useful 🔄.

What provokes the pain?.Stress: Stress increases muscle tension 😤. Relaxing practices will help the body rest 🧘‍♂️.

What provokes the pain?.Sleep: Pain after sleep may be related to posture or mattress 🛌. Try changing position or a supportive pillow 🛏️.

What provokes the pain?.Physical activity: Pain after activity indicates overstrain or poor technique ⚙️. Gentle warm-up and rest will help 🧘‍♀️.

Is there tension, numbness or tingling?.Yes: Tension, numbness or tingling may appear due to spasms or nerve compression 📍. Gentle stretching and rest will help 🧖‍♀️.

Is there tension, numbness or tingling?.No: No tension, numbness or tingling – excellent! 🎉

Is there tension, numbness or tingling?.Don't know: Watch sensations after load. If numbness or tingling appears, pay attention 👀.

Is there swelling? When does it appear?.In the morning: Morning swelling may be related to sleep or kidneys 🌅. Drink water during the day and limit salt in the evening 🚱.

Is there swelling? When does it appear?.In the evening: Evening swelling often appears due to leg load 🌆. Rest with elevated legs and light massage will help 🛌.

Is there swelling? When does it appear?.During the day: Daytime swelling may be related to low mobility 🏙️. Take breaks and stretch, watch water intake 💧.

Are there problems with breathing or che.Yes: If there are breathing difficulties, breathing exercises and chest relaxation will be useful 🫁.

Are there problems with breathing or che.No: There are no problems with breathing or chest, everything is good ✅.

Is the pain related to menstruation or c.Yes: Pain related to hormonal changes requires gentle load and attention to the pelvic area and lower back 🩸.

Is the pain related to menstruation or c.No: There is no connection of pain with menstruation or childbirth, you can move as usual 🔄.

Is there a fever or general weakness?.Yes: If there is fever or weakness 🤒, it may be a systemic issue. Consult a doctor 🩺.

Have you noticed posture changes?.Yes: Posture changes 🧍 may affect the spine and muscles. Gentle corrective exercises will help 🤸.

Have you noticed posture changes?.No: No posture changes detected, body balance is maintained ⚖️.

Do you want to add any additional inform.Yes: Additional information can help clarify the cause of pain 🔍.
